mapper.textPrompt:
You are a legal analyst AI trained in Indian case law.

Read the court judgment given below and extract structured legal information.
Use simple English but correct legal terminology.
Do NOT invent facts.
If something is not mentioned, write "Not mentioned".

Return the output STRICTLY in valid JSON format as follows:

{
  "court": "",
  "case_title": "",
  "year": "",
  "citation": "",
  "coram": "",
  "facts": "",
  "issues": [],
  "arguments_petitioner": "",
  "arguments_respondent": "",
  "decision": "",
  "reasoning": "",
  "ratio_decidendi": ""
}

Here is the judgment text:
<<<
{{17.text}}
>>>

model.label: Gemini 2.5 FlashApplies smart reasoning to fast data tasks while ensuring quick response times

mapper.textPrompt:
You must respond with ONLY valid JSON.
Do not include explanations.
Do not use backticks.
Do not add any text before or after the JSON.
Do not use markdown.

Return ONLY raw JSON.
Do NOT wrap the response in json or under any circumstances.

Do NOT include any unsupported video properties.
Do NOT include "style", "fontStyle", "theme", or any custom design keys.


Text elements must include ONLY:
- text
- size (small | medium | large)
- color (hex)

Title frame and scenes must strictly follow this structure:

{
  "title_frame": {
    "court": string,
    "case_title": string,
    "year": string,
    "citation": string,
    "coram": string
  },
  "scenes": [
    {
      "scene_number": number,
      "duration_seconds": number,
      "narration": string,
      "visual": string
    }
  ]
}

Return JSON only. No markdown. No explanations.

Also include start_time for each scene in seconds (cumulative).
Example:
Scene 1 start_time = 0
Scene 2 start_time = 7
Scene 3 start_time = 17
etc.


Here is the structured legal analysis of a court judgment:

<<<
{{18.result}}
>>>

You are a legal explainer AI.

Your task is to convert the given court judgment into a SHORT animated video script.

STRICT RULES:
1. Output MUST be valid JSON only.
2. Total video duration must be between 30 seconds and 2 minutes.
3. Divide the story into 6–8 scenes.
4. Each scene must include:
   - duration_seconds (number)
   - narration (spoken voice text, simple English)
   - visual (what is shown on screen, animated explainer style)
5. The first scene MUST be a title frame showing:
   - Court name
   - Case title
   - Year
6. Do NOT assume fixed characters like husband, wife, daughter-in-law.
   Use neutral terms like “Party A”, “Party B”, “the claimant”, “the respondent”.
7. Tone must be respectful, neutral, and educational.
8. Use simple English and basic legal terms only.
9. Explain WHY the court decided the case the way it did.
10. Mention the laws involved, but do not quote section numbers unless necessary.

Return ONLY JSON in the following format:

{
  "title_frame": {
    "court": "",
    "case_title": "",
    "year": "",
    "citation": "",
    "coram": ""
  },
  "scenes": [
    {
      "scene_number": 1,
      "duration_seconds": 6,
      "narration": "",
      "visual": ""
    }
  ]
}


IMPORTANT:
Return ONLY valid minified JSON.
Do not include markdown, code fences, explanations, or text outside JSON.

Return ONLY raw JSON.
Do NOT wrap the response in json or under any circumstances.

model.label: Gemini 2.5 FlashApplies smart reasoning to fast data tasks while ensuring quick response times

contentType.label: application/jsonEnter data in the JSON format, as a string or using a data structure.

inputMethod.label: JSON stringEnter the JSON body as a raw text string. If values contain JSON reserved characters, you must escape them manually.
